class_notes: (Course topic: Illness Narratives) In this course we will survey narrative illness and illness narrative to begin to get a better sense of empathy and its importance to the practice of medicine. We will privilege stories as a means to understand human beings when they are sick, weak, angry, incompetent, insane, blind, infected, dying, suffering, and so on. In short, those who are convalescent are our interest. We will read stories about and by those who attempt(ed) to treat them, or those inspired to understand them. Most importantly, we will practice how to write about illness following the precedents set by some of these authors with the goal of using your own knowledge to further refine a critical skill for your careers.
